document_data.name: Nutbread
document_data.mainbody: '''Nutbread''' was a type of common dark [[bread]] throughout [[Cormyr]], [[Dalelands]], and the [[Sword]]. It was often considered to be peasant fare, but consumed by lord and servant alike.
document_data.Description: Nutbread was a healthy type of dark bread, similar to [[pumpernickel]], notable for its density, and crumbliness, when poorly made. One notable type of nutbread was mraedin, eaten in the regions surrounding the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]], smothered in [[butter]].
document_data.Availability:
*In [[Cormyr]], nut bread could be found on the tables of nobles and simple folk. Lady Lord [[Tessaril Winter]] of [[Eveningstar]] favored nutbread served with [[cheese]], [[pickle]]s, and a tallglass of [[Saerloonian Glowfire]].
*In [[Shadowdale]], the [[Dalelands]], nutbread was known to be created through [[divine magic]] of [[cleric]]s.
*[[Baldur's Gate]]'s [[Blushing Mermaid]] inn served rolls of nutbread drowned in [[gravy]] and [[cheese handwheel]]s. This simple food was especially popular among sailors of the Gate.
*The village of [[Ulgoth's Beard]] on the Sword Coast served the local specialty stew â€“ [[gudgeon]], with coarsegrain nutbread.
*The [[Old Talking Ox]] in [[Iriaebor]] saved sweet dark [[molasses]] nutbread to its guests.
*The town of [[Gaj]] in the Vilhon Reach produced nutbread using walnuts.{{Cite web/theedverse/2022-12-15 - Gaj}}
*A type of common cheap [[Turmish]]ean meal consisted of a nutbread loaf with [[herb]]ed cheeses such as [[calmarr]] and [[ornsoelaun]], along with a bowl of [[onion]] and [[chive]] [[soup]].{{cite web| url = https://web.archive.org/web/20110901060101/https://candlekeep.com/library/articles/sse/sse_050607-04.htm| title = So Saith Ed May-Jul 2004| accessdate = 25-11-2021| date = 25-11-2021}}

Outside the [[Prime Material plane]], inhabitants [[Bytopia]] baked a type of aromatic [[spice]]d nutbread with [[carrot]]s and [[almond]]s. It was served in thick slices and tasted mildly sweet. It could be found exported as far as the planar city of [[Sigil]].
